chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John M Sulla was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John M Sulla in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant John M Sulla in custody.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense relates regarding some corrections to PSI. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement. 

Court relates and orders: 
Defendant is not eligible for the challenge incarceration but is eligible for earned release program.
Count 1: Total prison sentence of 8 years 0 months with 3 yrs 0 months initial confinement and 5 yrs 0 months extended supervision.
Dodge as reception center.
147 days credit.
ES conditions:
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
DNA sample, pay surcharge.
$600 fine + costs.
36 month DL revocation.
36 month IID.

.155 BAC

Voter's rights given.

Defendant John M Sulla in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Defendant John M Sulla in custody.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Court finds Defendant guilty to Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 - DRI. Any citations tracking to be dismissed. Defendant waives right to PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John M Sulla in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant John M Sulla in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:48 Chief Alan Gabe called and sworn - Direct by State 9:57 Cross exam by Attorney Hinde 9:59 State moves to bind over 10:00 Court finds probable cause and binds over - Information filed - Reading of Information waived - Defendant stands mute and court enters not guilty pleas on his behalf  Plea hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must not enter bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents or any other establishments that sell/serve alcoholic beverages unless their primary business is to serve food.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant John M Sulla in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Defendant John M Sulla in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 09:45 am.
